solution_line_template: Mr. Benson had a 5% discount for each of the {total_tickets} - {discount_threshold} = <<{total_tickets}-{discount_threshold}={discounted_tickets}>>{discounted_tickets} tickets.
So, those two tickets had a ${ticket_price} x {discount_percentage} = $<<{ticket_price}*{discount_percentage}={discount_per_ticket}>>{discount_per_ticket} discount each.
Thus, two discounted tickets amount to ${discounted_ticket_price} x {discounted_tickets} = $<<{discounted_ticket_price}*{discounted_tickets}={total_discounted}>>{total_discounted}.
And the other ten tickets amount to ${ticket_price} x {full_price_tickets} = $<<{ticket_price}*{full_price_tickets}={total_full_price}>>{total_full_price}.
Hence, Mr. Benson paid a total of ${total_full_price} + ${total_discounted} = $<<{total_full_price}+{total_discounted}={answer}>>{answer}.
